title: Commanding Heights : Anand Panyarachun | on PBS

quotes: About that period of intense growth you were talking about, the 20 [to] 30 years, in the West, people would talk about the Asian miracle, the success of Asian values on this particular model.
We were doing pretty well for 30, 40 years.
It was something that was tried out in England 200 years ago, or in America 100 years ago.

We were all doing well -- Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore, and at the head of the formation would be Japan, but then you have second-tier, third-tier developing countries that seem to be moving ahead with no end in sight.
So did Korea; so did Taiwan.
